question: My child and I immigrated to the U.S. four years ago and have a lawfully present status. What are our coverage options?
text:
My child and I immigrated to the U.S. four years ago and have a lawfully present status. What are our coverage options?
          
        
Virginia's Insurance Marketplace will work with you to explore you and your childs coverage options to determine which programs you qualify for, as well as how to apply and enroll. Head to www.marketplace.virginia.gov to complete your application and understand your coverage options. For example, you may be able to enroll in coverage through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace with financial assistance to help lower the cost of coverage, while your child might qualify for Medical Assistance or the Family Access to Medical Insurance Security Plan (
FAMIS
) If thats the case, you will be able to apply and enroll in coverage through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace, while your child would be connected to free or low-cost coverage through Medical Assistance or FAMIS.
Virginia residents who are lawfully present in the United States may qualify for Medical Assistance.   Individuals interested in healthcare coverage should apply online through
commonhelp.virginia.gov
.  If the individual is determined ineligible for Medical Assistance, their information will be transferred to Virginia's Insurance Marketplace or to FAMIS, which covers uninsured children under 19.
No matter how you apply, we are committed to ensuring your application gets to the right place so you can enroll in the health coverage that meets the needs of you and your family.
